alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Steuben, northeastern De Kalb and southwestern Williams Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Edon, or 9 miles northeast of Butler, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hamilton around 420 PM EDT. Edgerton around 430 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Edgerton In Williams County and Butler. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 154 and 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
